TF027899-NEPAL - BPEP II COORDINATION,TF029645-PHRD-BASIC & PRIMARY
            EDUCATION II PROJ.

abstracts.cdata!:
The Second Basic and Primary Education
            Project (BPEP2) for Nepal had the following ratings: the
            outcome was satisfactory, the sustainability was likely, the
            institutional development impact was substantial, and the
            Bank and borrower performance were both satisfactory. The
            lessons learned indicate if core issues, such as teacher
            deployment, teacher absenteeism or poor teacher management,
            are not adequately dealt with, then development inputs, such
            as improved planning and education system monitoring, are
            less effective. Importance of ensuring sufficient financial
            support for non-salary recurrent costs was lacking under the
            project and limited the impact of some quality-enhancement
            measures. It was important that BPEP2 instill mechanisms and
            processes to ensure accountability of public officials to
            beneficiaries. Adopting a holistic view of education system
            development over a drive will meet targets. Much of the
            teacher training under BPEP2 was deemed to be too abstract.
            Keeping overall responsibility for BPEP2 donor coordination
            in the hands of His Majesty's Government of Nepal
            (HMG/N) reduced potential levels of tension, complexity and
            duplication of efforts. Better quality assurance of input
            data supports enhanced education system monitoring.
